newsitem.title: USA: PanAmSat, Hughes shrs extend gains.
newsitem.headline: PanAmSat, Hughes shrs extend gains.

text.p: PanAmSat Corp shares rose 3/4 to 28-1/2 in the first minutes of Friday Nasdaq trade following the company's announcement that it will merge its satellite communications with those of Hughes Electronics Corp.
The early gains added to the one point rise yesterday that was fueled by reports that the companies were assembling the deal and were due to announce it imminently.
Meanwhile, Hughes shares jumped 2-1/8 to 59-7/8 on the New York Stock Exchange, adding to a 3/4 gain Thursday.

Cai Von Rumohr, Cowen & Co's satellite analyst, said, "I like it (the deal). Strategically it makes a huge amount of sense. Hughes is the market leader domestically and PanAmSat is the international leader."
He said his preliminary calculations show a slight dilution of PanAmSat's 1997 earnings "maybe by a dime" and the 1998 earnings impact "is a wash or slightly accretive."
In 1995, the company lost $0.08 per share on revenues of $116 million.
Before March 2, 1995 PanAmSat operated as a partnership and was not subject to federal or state income tax, it said.
PanAmSat's 1995 earnings before income tax, depreciation and amortization were $66.2 million versus $36.7 million.

The deal will also "increase the visibility of one of Hughes more attractive businesses by putting a piece of paper out there (the publicly traded securities that will result from the deal) that is not buried in this great big corporation," Von Rumohr said, referring to Hughes being part of General Motors Corp.
